page.title: 01BRIGG AND DISTRICT
page.content:
Our area lies immediately to the east of the River Ancholme and twenty eight kilometres south of the River Humber. The county boundary between South Humberside and Lincolnshire crosses the area from east to west. The land is low lying and is drained by a network of ditches taking water towards the River Ancholme. {Arable {farming} is the main activity with barley, wheat, sugar beet and rape being the main crops.
To the north west of the block lies part of the {market town}of Brigg which grew up at a point where it was possible to cross the Ancholme Valley before successful {drainage }of the land. Brigg serves the surrounding rural area and has a cattle market on Tuesday and street markets on Thursdays and Saturdays.
